member.name: T:System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryFormat
member.summary: The delivery format to use for sending outgoing email using the Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP).

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryFormat.International
member.summary: A delivery format where non-ASCII characters in the envelope and header fields used in the Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP) for mail messages are encoded with UTF-8 characters. The extensions to support international email are defined in IETF RFC 6530, 6531, and 6532.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryFormat.SevenBit
member.summary: A delivery format using 7-bit ASCII. The traditional delivery format used in the Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP) for mail messages.

member.name: T:System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryMethod
member.summary: Specifies how email messages are delivered.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryMethod.Network
member.summary: Email is sent through the network to an SMTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryMethod.PickupDirectoryFromIis
member.summary: Email is copied to the pickup directory used by a local Internet Information Services (IIS) for delivery.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryMethod.SpecifiedPickupDirectory
member.summary: Email is copied to the directory specified by the property for delivery by an external application.

member.name: T:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode
member.summary: Specifies the outcome of sending email by using the class.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.BadCommandSequence
member.summary: The commands were sent in the incorrect sequence.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.CannotVerifyUserWillAttemptDelivery
member.summary: The specified user is not local, but the receiving SMTP service accepted the message and attempted to deliver it. This status code is defined in RFC 1123, which is available at https://www.ietf.org.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.ClientNotPermitted
member.summary: The client was not authenticated or is not allowed to send mail using the specified SMTP host.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.CommandNotImplemented
member.summary: The SMTP service does not implement the specified command.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.CommandParameterNotImplemented
member.summary: The SMTP service does not implement the specified command parameter.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.CommandUnrecognized
member.summary: The SMTP service does not recognize the specified command.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.ExceededStorageAllocation
member.summary: The message is too large to be stored in the destination mailbox.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.GeneralFailure
member.summary: The transaction could not occur. You receive this error when the specified SMTP host cannot be found.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.HelpMessage
member.summary: A Help message was returned by the service.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.InsufficientStorage
member.summary: The SMTP service does not have sufficient storage to complete the request.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.LocalErrorInProcessing
member.summary: The SMTP service cannot complete the request. This error can occur if the client's IP address cannot be resolved (that is, a reverse lookup failed). You can also receive this error if the client domain has been identified as an open relay or source for unsolicited email (spam). For details, see RFC 2505, which is available at https://www.ietf.org.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.MailboxBusy
member.summary: The destination mailbox is in use.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.MailboxNameNotAllowed
member.summary: The syntax used to specify the destination mailbox is incorrect.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.MailboxUnavailable
member.summary: The destination mailbox was not found or could not be accessed.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.MustIssueStartTlsFirst
member.summary: The SMTP server is configured to accept only TLS connections, and the SMTP client is attempting to connect by using a non-TLS connection. The solution is for the user to set EnableSsl=true on the SMTP Client.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.Ok
member.summary: The email was successfully sent to the SMTP service.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.ServiceClosingTransmissionChannel
member.summary: The SMTP service is closing the transmission channel.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.ServiceNotAvailable
member.summary: The SMTP service is not available; the server is closing the transmission channel.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.ServiceReady
member.summary: The SMTP service is ready.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.StartMailInput
member.summary: The SMTP service is ready to receive the email content.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.SyntaxError
member.summary: The syntax used to specify a command or parameter is incorrect.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.SystemStatus
member.summary: A system status or system Help reply.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.TransactionFailed
member.summary: The transaction failed.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.UserNotLocalTryAlternatePath
member.summary: The user mailbox is not located on the receiving server. You should resend using the supplied address information.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode.UserNotLocalWillForward
member.summary: The user mailbox is not located on the receiving server; the server forwards the email.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mime.MediaTypeNames.Application.Zip
member.summary: Specifies that the data is compressed.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mime.MediaTypeNames.Image.Tiff
member.summary: Specifies that the data is in Tagged Image File Format (TIFF).

member.name: F:System.Net.Mime.MediaTypeNames.Text.Xml
member.summary: Specifies that the data is in XML format.

member.name: T:System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the Content-Transfer-Encoding header information for an email message attachment.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding.Base64
member.summary: Encodes stream-based data. See RFC 2406 Section 6.8.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding.EightBit
member.summary: The data is in 8-bit characters that may represent international characters with a total line length of no longer than 1000 8-bit characters. For more information about this 8-bit MIME transport extension, see IETF RFC 6152.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Encodes data that consists of printable characters in the US-ASCII character set. See RFC 2406 Section 6.7.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding.SevenBit
member.summary: Used for data that is not encoded. The data is in 7-bit US-ASCII characters with a total line length of no longer than 1000 characters. See RFC2406 Section 2.7.

member.name: F:System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates that the transfer encoding is unknown.
